description.excerpt:
Neural Style learning is one of the most exciting sides of deep learning.Ever wondered if Angelina Jolie was painted by Da Vinci?
Neural Style Transfer (NST) uses a previously trained convolutional network, and builds on top of that. The idea of using a network trained on a different task and applying it to a new task is called transfer learning.
Neural Style Transfer is an algorithm that given a content image C and a style image S can generate an artistic image
It uses representations (hidden layer activations) based on a pretrained ConvNet.
The style cost function for one layer is computed using the Gram matrix of that layer's activations.

The style of an image can be represented using the Gram matrix of a hidden layer's activations. However, we get even better results combining this representation from multiple different layers.
This is in contrast to the content representation, where usually using just a single hidden layer is sufficient.
*Minimizing the style cost will cause the image GG to follow the style of the image SS.
Implement the neural style transfer algorithm.Generate novel artistic images using your algorithm #Deep Learning

invocation.excerpt: Optimizing the total cost function results in synthesizing new images.

long_title.excerpt: What if Statue of Liberty was painted by Picasso?
